message.raw:
get_prefix_linux only worked for locations mounted using gvfs in the home directory of the user running the script. Mounted location might not use gvfs (e.g. on distributions where gvfs isn't  used, and/or those using etc/fstab).
Implemented support for such mounts, used after checking existence/use of gvfs.
As this module returns the mount point of any mounted filesystem on Linux (using gvfs, /etc/fstab), consider rename of:
* module "shared_drive" to "mount_point" or "mountpoint"
* function "get_prefix" to "get_mount_point" or "get_mountpoint" or "get_mtpt"
Also added os.sep to output of get_prefix_win, such that:
os.path.join( get_prefix( some_mount ), some_directory) works on Windows and Linux.
